key_title: Key to the species of Medicago

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Pods spiny or tuberculate
Pods smooth, neither spiny nor tuberculate
Inflorescence 1–10-flowered, rarely to 15-flowered; peduncles less than twice as long as subtending petioles
Inflorescence 10–50-flowered; peduncles more than twice as long as subtending petioles
Pods reniform, with 1 small coil at the tip, 1-seeded; corolla yellow; standard 2–2.5 mm long
Pods cylindric, with 2 or 3 coils, 2–10-seeded; corolla violet; standard 6–12.5 mm long
Pod coils 2.5–10 mm diam., lateral veins prominent
Pod coils more than 10 mm diam., lateral veins obscure
Stems glabrescent; stipules laciniate; peduncle with or without a cusp; keel shorter than wings; young pod usually glabrous
Stems covered with a mixture of simple and glandular hairs; stipules ruggedly toothed along margins; peduncle prominently cuspidate; keel slightly longer than wings; young pod densely glandular-hairy
Pods lenticular, coils stacked on top of one another
Pods ellipsoid or cup-shaped, lower coils of pods enclosing upper ones
Upper surface of leaflets sparsely to densely hairy when young
Upper surface of leaflets glabrous
Stipules hairy on both surfaces, entire or shallowly toothed; pod soft-walled, coils easy to separate, dorsal suture c. 0.3 mm wide, spines slender, grooved at base

Stipules usually hairy only on lower surface (rarely a few hairs on upper surface also), deeply toothed or laciniate; pod hard-walled, coils difficult to separate, dorsal suture c. 0.2 mm wide, spines stout, conical or slightly grooved at base
Leaflets entire or toothed, never laciniate
At least some leaflets laciniate
Corolla less than 7 mm long; pod ovoid, cylindric or discoid, coils less than 9 mm diam. (excluding spines), spines 1–5 mm long
Corolla 7–10 mm long; pod ovoid, coils more than 9 mm diam. (excluding spines), spines many, appressed, 3–7 mm long
Leaflets not dark-blotched; hairs simple; dorsal suture of pod not grooved
Leaflets usually with a central dark blotch; hairs simple or a mixture of simple and glandular; dorsal suture of pod bisected by a shallow groove
Inflorescences 1–3-flowered; calyx teeth shorter than tube; keel longer than wings
Inflorescences 1–10-flowered; calyx teeth longer than tube; keel shorter than wings
